
- Listwise: drops any row with *any* NA for *all* calculations

- Pairwise: drops rows with NA only for the variables being compared

```{r}
data <- data.frame(
  X1 = c(1, 2, NA, 4, 5),
  X2 = c(2, NA, 3, 4, 5),
  X3 = c(NA, 2, 3, 4, NA)
)

data


```

```{r}
# Remove any row with at least one NA
listwise_data <- na.omit(data)

listwise_data


```

```{r}
# Correlation matrix with listwise deletion
cor_listwise <- cor(data, use = "complete.obs")
cor_listwise


```

```{r}

# Pairwise deletion happens automatically if you set use="pairwise.complete.obs"
cor_pairwise <- cor(data, use = "pairwise.complete.obs")
cor_pairwise
```
